value.title: How to refresh web sources in Power BI service
value.excerpt: If you have connected to a web source in power bi desktop and they try to connect to the service, you have probably gotten this error:  "You can't schedule refresh for this dataset because the following data sources currently don't support refresh: Data source for Query1"  In today's video I am going

value.title: Insert blank rows at each category in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to have a blank row after each category or subcategory, so you can visualize your data in a table?   In this video I will show you how to add a blank row for each group using power query in one step!  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Remove duplicates on multiple columns -#5 (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to remove duplicates from multiple columns in Power Query.  It is very easy to use and it will save you some steps and workarounds. value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

In Power Query we have some functions using which we can convert our local date

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query

value.title: Remove Duplicate Does not Work in Power Query for Power BI Here is the Solution
value.excerpt: One of the most common transformations in Power Query is the Remove Duplicates. This transformation is used in many scenarios, one of the examples, is to create a dimension table with unique IDs in it, so can be used as the source of a one to many relationships to fact tables in the relationship diagram
